intro: Peperomia guanacastana, commonly known as the Guanacastan peperomia, is a species native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a compact, upright shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green, with some varieties displaying variegation. It produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown, which are followed by small, round berries. Peperomia guanacastana is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and attractive foliage.
